title: Nvidia's price target increases 32% on AI wave: Mizuho
text: Justin Sullivan/Getty Images News Nvidia's (NASDAQ:NVDA) price target was raised from $625 to $825 by analysts at Mizuho Securities ahead of its latest financial results surfacing next week. "We continue to see NVDA as the best AI/ML play, pushing the tip of the spear in AI training," said Mizuho's Vijay Rakesh in an investor note Tuesday. "We believe NVDA currently dominates the AI server market, and we expect it to maintain its significant market share," Mizuho added. After dropping slightly during early morning trading, Nvidia ticked up about 1% to $728 near noon Tuesday. Nvidia's stock price has shot up 45% since Jan. 1. The firm also increased Broadcom's (AVGO) price target to $1,450 from $1,250. Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) received a price target push to $200 from $175. Mizuho maintains a Buy rating for all three stocks. Analysts have mixed views on Nvidia. It has a HOLD rating from Seeking Alpha authors, while Wall Street analysts rate it a STRONG BUY. Meanwhile, Seeking Alpha's quant system, which consistently beats the market, rates Nvidia a HOLD. Nvidia is slated to report fourth-quarter results on Feb. 21. A consensus of analysts expects the company to earn $4.56 per share and $20.33B in revenue. Broadcom plans to report its latest financial results on March 7. A consensus of analysts expects the company to earn $10.42 per share on revenue of $11.73B.
